text: So I know what this is and I know what it can do I think we have to be extremely careful because I don't think anything is exactly what What the algorithm or the materials say it is That I don't think that's true for For humans in terms of the laws of biochemistry, and I don't think it's true for machines because of the formal limitations of the algorithms that they're supposedly running That's it Here's just the summary of these ideas We now have a research agenda for all of this stuff I'd just like to thank the people who did all the work These are the postdocs and the students in my group, and we have lots of collaborators And I have to do a disclosure There are three companies that I'm involved with Thank you
content_summary: The speaker, Michael Levin, discusses the limitations of both biochemical laws in humans and formal algorithms in machines, expressing a need for caution in understanding their capabilities. He also acknowledges the contributions of his research team and discloses his involvement with three companies.
